柜台-罢工：条件为零

Counter-Strike: Condition Zero is a follow up to the original Counter-Strike game. This game was released in 2004, so almost eleven years ago. Condition Zero uses the Half-Life engine.

What we have here is a CS game which includes a single player mission pack. When it comes to playing Counter-Strike, I am more or less a newb at it. This game gave me the perfect opportunity to learn the guns, maps and mission types without the pressure of feeling like you are letting your team down by sucking. The campaign took me about four hours to complete, but this was only on Normal mode, you can go back and replay the missions on a higher difficulty to eventually work your way up to playing online.

I also found the squad management system to be a nice little feature which isn't seen in other CS games, at the start of each mission, you can choose which squad members to take with you on the mission, each of the team members have their positive and negative stats so you can really get stuck in with min-maxing them. You start out with three members and you work you way up to having a full blown squad of about eight men.

On each of the missions you also have to complete specific challenges, these can be goals set around killing a certain amount of people, winning the match in less than ninety seconds, rescuing a specific amount of hostages etc etc. This added a little variety of play, especially the challenges where you have to use a certain weapon in order to complete them. This allowed you to learn how to use other guns effectively rather than sticking with your tried and tested Rifle and Deagle.

While the graphics do not come close to looking like games we have in the current day, the game still does look nice. I wasn't put off by the dated graphics one bit; I guess that just shows how good the Half Life engine actually is!

The difficulty levels completely rely on how hard you want to make it. I started out on Normal mode just to get to grips with the game as I am newb like that; but you can work all the way up to playing as if you are in a match online and have the brutally hard experience if you want to. Easy mode is complete walk in the park though, enemies can be standing in front of you for about three seconds before they realize they should shoot you, and even then they spray bullets randomly all around you without actually hitting, so I wouldn't recommend you start out on Easy mode.

Like I said, the campaign took me about four hours to complete, but there are two or three more difficulty levels to try out, and I can see this adding a lot of variety into the game play, so I can easily see the single player alone taking about twelve hours to complete it fully on all difficulties.

I found no technical issues what so ever while playing, I would assume all the bugs and ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ would of been ironed out years ago..

In conclusion I can easily recommend Counter-Strike: Condition Zero for anyone looking to get into the FPS or CS scene, it will easily give you a worthwhile experience, giving you the opportunity to learn all of the CS maps, guns and game modes in a pressure free environment.

Купил эту игру не ради онлайна, а ради дополнения Deleted Scenes. Давно хотел поиграть, но, возможно по моей глупости, я не мог найти его на торрентах, везде был только оригинал с довольно скучной кампанией, состоящей из обычных пострелушек с ботами. Но кампания Deleted Scenes совсем другое дело. Ощущается конечно круто, что то на подобие операций из CS:GO. Но вот перепроходить миссии желания нет. Стелс тут боли заскриптован, снаряжение можно использовать лишь в определённых местах, а враги тут довольно глупые. Однако, пройти разок однозначно стоит, всё таки кс с кампанией - довольно интересный экспириенс.

When i 1st played this CS Condition Zero Deleted Scenes wayback 2004... i was surprised that my country Philippines was included in the game and so proud of it... but ive never been to Basilan or any part of Mindanao south of the country with lots of terrorists activities... this mission seems very creepy u will see corpses with open organs, hear eerie sounds in the jungle and site is very secluded... felt this is a real scenario happening in the south....

Mission 2: Lost Cause:
part 1: https://www.facebook.com/756263564/videos/416333853864896/
part 2: https://www.facebook.com/756263564/videos/1487769464999200/

i love CZ as much as i love CS 1.6... its just an updated CS 1.6 with better graphics, textures, details, models and new maps... love the bots also here, for me CZ has the best bots {better than Podbots i think), and glad it can be also used in CS 1.6...

the 3 game play modes of CZ are really great, coz u can play as single and Multiplayer... love the missions in single player....

multiplayer with bots: 
part 1: https://www.facebook.com/756263564/videos/1523351904734441/
part 2: https://www.facebook.com/756263564/videos/548693747042104/

One reason i bought CS Condition Zero Deleted Scenes (that i can easily get free from other site and i have the original CZ CD too) from Steam is to play the 6 extra bonus missions that aren't not present in my official CS CZ disc... these 6 extra maps after the final mission Rise Hard are: Fastline,Truth in chaos, Run!, Pipe Dream, Sandstorm, Pipe Dream, Miami Heat... been searching for these mission maps in several CS downloading site but can't find one thats complete... so my last resort is to get the one on Steam... these are the only missions i havent played completely. I played the 12 missions many times and also finished some custom and unofficial release maps already...so all in all it has 18 official missions....😊

[h1] Counter Strike: Condition Zero [/h1]

Let me be clear - [b] I HATE THIS GAME [/b]. After 66 hours I finally finished all quests. 66 hours of [u] joy [/u] suffering. Boring and harcore challanges will not let you enjoy this game. By the way, if you buy CS:CZ in the Steam, you will get 2 games: CS:CZ and CS:CZ Deleted Scenes. In my opinion, CS:CZ should not exist. Devs could release Deleted Scenes as unique singleplayer CS game.
[b] First [/b] reason is uselessness of existance. The game was released on March 26th 2004 and it had outdated grapghics. For example, Half-Life 2 was realesed on 16th of November 2004 and It was a revolution in the gaming world. CS:CZ has a bit better grapgic than original CS.
[b] Secong [/b] reason is an existance of CS:Source and original CS. This games are way more better than CZ.
  [b]Finally [b], this game is SO [b] FU**ING BORING [/b] .  0/10

[b] P.S [/b]. This review  is my personal opinion
